com.stoyanr.evictor.map

Class EvictibleEntry<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stoyanr.evictor.map.EvictibleEntry<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of keys maintained by the map
    V - the type of mapped values
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Map.Entry<K,V>

    public class EvictibleEntry<K,V>
extends Object
implements Map.Entry<K,V>
    An evictible map Map.Entry used by ConcurrentMapWithTimedEvictionDecorator and other interfaces and classes in this package. Besides the key and the value, the entry has additional properties such as its map, eviction time, and custom data, as well as additional helper methods.
    Author:
    Stoyan Rachev

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void evict(boolean cancelPendingEviction)
      Actually evicts the entry from its map by calling the evict method on the map, passing the specified flag.

      Returns the additional data associated with this entry.

      Returns the eviction time of this entry, in nanoseconds.

      Returns the key corresponding to this entry.

      Returns the value corresponding to this entry.
      boolean isEvictible()
      Returns true if the entry is evictible.

      Sets the additional data associated with this entry.

      Replaces the value corresponding to this entry with the specified value.

      Returns true if the entry should be evicted.
      String toString()

      • setValue

        public V setValue(V value)
        Replaces the value corresponding to this entry with the specified value. (Writes through to the map.)
        Specified by:
        setValue in interface Map.Entry<K,V>
        Parameters:
        value - new value to be stored in this entry
        Returns:
        old value corresponding to the entry
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the class of the specified value prevents it from being stored in the backing map
        NullPointerException - if the specified value is null

      • isEvictible

        public boolean isEvictible()
        Returns true if the entry is evictible. An entry is evictible if the value of evictMs specified upon its construction was positive.
        Returns:
        true if the entry is evictible

      • getEvictionTime

        public long getEvictionTime()
        Returns the eviction time of this entry, in nanoseconds. This time is calculated upon creation by adding the specified evictMs to the current time returned by System.nanoTime().
        Returns:
        the eviction time of this entry in nanoseconds.

      • getData

        public Object getData()
        Returns the additional data associated with this entry.
        Returns:
        the additional data associated with this entry

      • setData

        public void setData(Object data)
        Sets the additional data associated with this entry.
        Parameters:
        data - additional data associated with this entry

      • shouldEvict

        public boolean shouldEvict()
        Returns true if the entry should be evicted. An entry should be evicted if it is evictible and its eviction time is less than System.nanoTime().
        Returns:
        true if the entry should be evicted

      • evict

        public void evict(boolean cancelPendingEviction)
        Actually evicts the entry from its map by calling the evict method on the map, passing the specified flag.
        Parameters:
        cancelPendingEviction - true if any pending evictions of the entry should be cancelled

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
